messages.content: You are a sales assistant bot that helps sales agents in converting enterprise sales

Following is a set of dialogues that happened between a sales agent and a prospect from Account. ```08/12/2022- Opened up conversation with Ken Walnut regarding a potential opportunity to add some intelligence to the company sales data. 16/12/2022- Had a discovery call with Ken and Geoff VP Global sales to ascertain the pain points - they indicated that the sales process is overly complicated and they need to streamline this as well as to increase average deal size. They want to be able to better service their existing clients by improving their customer success rates to help protect their renewal rates. They use Salesforce and Gong.io as well as Outreach for their early-stage lead generation. Agreed to move forward with a solution demo. They have too many disparet sales systems Want to provide a seamless unified platform expereince allowing the user to do majority of the work in one application. 17/12/2022- Sent NDA for signature. 20/12/2022- Still awaiting NDA to be returned. Also emailed Jim Jackson, head of operations, to introduce myself and Dealstream with a view to perhaps including him on the planned demo session. 23/12/2022- Emailed stakeholders to push for the NDA and to suggest suitable dates/times for the demonstration. 01/01/2023- NDA returned and the 7th January 2023 agreed as the best date for the demonstration. Emailed Ken to identify and inform us of the attendees for the session. 07/01/2023- The demo session went well. They indicated that they loved the UI/UX; however, they would need to ensure that the integration with their whole tech stack, including Gong, would be something that we could do. Need to set up a call with their team and our product management team to give them confidence that this integration work can be delivered. In addition, there was some concern around data privacy which they need their Data Privacy team to look into. I have asked them to send us their DPA, which they will hopefully do by the end of the week. 14/01/2023- Discussion Points: Conducted a comprehensive needs analysis with Account. Explored specific pain points and challenges they face. Discussed how the AI software solution could address these challenges effectively. 21/01/2023- Held a meeting to discuss data privacy and security considerations related to the AI software solution. Addressed how the solution complies with Account' data protection requirements. 22/01/2023- Held a product demo showcasing the key features and capabilities of the AI software solution. Demonstrated how it could be integrated into Account' existing systems to enhance their operations. 30/01/2023- Addressed questions and concerns that arose after the product demo. Clarified technical aspects, integration requirements, and potential ROI that Account could expect. 07/02/2023- Presented a tailored proposal outlining the AI software solution, its benefits, and how it aligns with Account' needs. Discussed pricing options and potential implementation timelines. 14/02/2023- Customer mentioned that they are likely to go to RFP to around 5 solutions and that the RFP will be released over the next 3 weeks latest by 28th Feb 2023. I am working with the internal RFP team to assist with providing the client with an RFP template to send to the client. 21/02/2023- Sent the client the RFP template - discovered that two of the competitors are Humantics AI and FairSale. The client has not committed to using our template - still awaiting the RFP document from the client. 28/02/2023- RFP document is delayed and project stalled for a couple of weeks due to internal priorities of the stakeholder team. 07/03/2023- RFP document released. It is the customer's own template; however, I do see some similarity in many of the points in the document with our template. I suspect that they have utilized some of what I sent to them. RFP response is due in 2 weeks from now, 21st March 2023. 14/03/2023- Completing RFP documentation - still awaiting feedback from Product Marketing on our roadmap and what can be released to the customer as part of the response. Also awaiting the DPA section of the RFP to be completed by our data privacy team. 20/03/2023- Submitted RFP response this morning complete with pricing at 350K USD per annum for licenses and 200K implementation. 25/03/2023- A session has been set up and invites sent by the client to attend a Q&A regarding our response - all key stakeholders are to attend on the BA side. 27/03/2023- Q&A session went very well; we answered all of their points, and I proposed that we deliver a tailored Post-RFP workshop to take them through a configured demo covering all of their use cases. 28/03/2023- The customer has asked us to deliver the workshop on the 14th April. Working internally with the solution consulting team to prepare the demo environment. 30/03/2023- Spoken with my main champion there, Geoff Gables, VP Sales - he stated that they are currently in the process of securing budget internally - apparently, there are a few rounds of approval and the final approval meeting happens on the 21st April 2023. I asked what level of budget that they are looking to secure and they stated enough to cover the requirements of the solution - wouldn't give an exact figure. 14/04/2023- Demo session went very well - a 4-hour-long session; all stakeholders, including Economic Buyer Jim Jackson, Head of Operations, in attendance. We covered all of their main points - a few questions came up on service delivery and SOW; the next step is to build out the SOW. I proposed a Value Engineering session to build out a Proof of Value document - they accepted. Agreed to kick off the value engineering session on 21st April. 21/04/2023- Completed value engineering call, and we will have the POV document with them by the end of the week. 27/04/2023- Delivered Value Engineering POV. 27/04/2023 - Deliverd Value engineering POV. 28/04/2023- Started work on the SOW internally aiming to deliver the SOW with the final implementation program by 5th May 2023. 05/05/2023- Delivered SOW to the client - total services 195K. 07/05/2023- SOW call with the customer to discuss the timeline and project plan in more detail. 10/05/2023- Called my Champion, Geoff Gables, and asked him when the target date is for announcing VOC - he stated by the end of next week. 17/05/2023- We have been awarded VOC and have now moved into discussions with Procurement. The first call with Procurement is set for next week. 25/05/2023- Had a call with procurement who have stated that we need to look at reducing our price across the board in order for this to move forward. 26/05/2023- I discussed with internal management and we have agreed to offer a 5% discount given that our RFP price was already reduced by 20% from the list - this additional discount is tied to an end of June close date. 27/05/2023- I met with both the EC and the champion today to discuss building a Mutual Activity Plan for us all to work towards completing all outstanding items to close. 27/05/2023- Sent our MSA and Order form to the client today to process the terms through their legal team. 29/05/2023- Meeting with the Legal team and our legal team scheduled for 7/06/2023. 30/05/2023- Had a conversation with the EB, and he indicated that a clause for termination for convenience will be required - I mentioned that this is not possible due to our revenue recognition requirements and that termination for cause will be added. 07/06/2023- First legal call to discuss their points on the contract went well - we have some outstanding points around Termination for convenience and Support terms. 09/06/2023- We addressed the client's redlines and returned the contract. 10/06/2023- I built the MAP and sent the template to the client today for their review. 15/06/2023- Legal confirmed today that they are happy with the MSA and will submit it to procurement to push through the signature process. 20/06/2023- Discovered today that the signatory is on vacation until 4th July. I reiterated that our price holds until the end of June and we need to find a backup signatory. 26/06/2023- A backup signatory identified and contract in for signature with Ian Harper, COO. 30/06/2023- Contract signed today, and the Order form expected tomorrow, however, will be dated 30th June - some minor terms on the order form came up at the last minute; our Sales Ops are changing. 01/07/2023- Order form signed and PO received - Deal closed.``` identify the pain points faced by Account in its current workflows.

The sales process is excessively complex and requires simplification. Aim to enhance average transaction volume. Enhance customer satisfaction to boost renewal rate percentages. There's a need to lessen the disparity in their technology stack with a single unified platform.
You are a sales assistant bot that helps sales agents in converting enterprise sales

Following is a set of dialogues that happened between a sales agent and a prospect from Account. ```08/12/2022- Initiated a dialogue with Ken Walnut to explore the possibility of infusing intelligence into the company's sales data. 16/12/2022- Had an exploratory call with Ken and Geoff, VP Global Sales, to identify their main issues. They suggested that the sales process is too intricate and requires streamlining, in addition to an increase in the average deal size. Their goal is to improve customer success rates, allowing them to better service their current clients and safeguard their renewal rates. For their early stage lead generation, they utilize Salesforce, Gong.io, and Outreach. Gave the nod to proceed with a demonstration of the solution. They are dealing with a multitude of inconsistent sales systems. Aiming to offer a unified, seamless platform where most tasks can be performed within a single application. 17/12/2022- Dispatched the NDA for signing. 20/12/2022- I'm yet to receive the returned NDA. Additionally, I've reached out to Jim Jackson, the head of operations, to introduce myself and Dealstream, in the hopes of possibly involving him in our upcoming demo session. 23/12/2022- Wrote to stakeholders encouraging them to push for the NDA and suggesting appropriate dates and times for the demonstration. 01/01/2023- Ken was emailed following the NDA's return, with the 7th January 2023 confirmed as the optimal date for the session. He was asked to pinpoint and notify us about the demonstration attendees. 07/01/2023- The demonstration session proceeded smoothly. They expressed their satisfaction with the UI/UX, yet they stressed the need to confirm if we can integrate with their entire tech stack, including Gong. We need to arrange a conference call between their team and our product management team to assure them that the task of integration can be effectively carried out. In addition, there was some concern around data privacy which they need their Data Privacy team to look into. I've requested that they share their DPA with us, hopefully by the end of this week. 14/01/2023- Topics Covered: Carried out a detailed needs analysis with Account, examining specific aspects they struggle with. Explored how the AI software solution could rectify these issues effectively. 21/01/2023- Convened an assembly focused on deliberating over data privacy and security concerns surrounding our AI software solution. Explored how it aligns with Account' data protection guidelines. 22/01/2023- Conducted a product demo featuring the utmost features and capabilities of an AI software solution. Showed how it could be seamlessly incorporated into Account' existing systems for operational enhancement. 30/01/2023- Answered queries and alleviated concerns that emerged post the product demonstration. Explained the technical matters, integration needs, and possible return on investment that could be anticipated by Account. 07/02/2023- Outlined a customized proposal presenting the AI software solution, its advantages, and its compatibility with the specific requirements of Account. Also, conversed on pricing structures and possible execution schedules. 14/02/2023- The client noted they're considering sending RFPs to about five solutions and plan to release the RFP within the upcoming three weeks at the latest, by February 28th, 2023. I am collaborating with the internal RFP team to furnish a suitable RFP template for the client to use. 21/02/2023- Dispatched the RFP template to the client, and found out that our competitors are Humantics AI and FairSale. We're still waiting for the client's commitment to use our template and return the RFP document to us. 28/02/2023- The stakeholder team's internal priorities have caused a delay in the RFP document and stalled the project for several weeks. 07/03/2023- The RFP document has been issued, and it appears to be the customer's own template. However, I have noticed a number of similarities to our own template. I suspect that they incorporated some aspects from what I sent them. As per the schedule, the RFP response is due on 21st March 2023, which is around two weeks from today. 14/03/2023- We are still awaiting feedback from our Product Marketing team regarding our road map—information required for completing the RFP documentation. Also, our data privacy team is yet to complete the DPA section of the RFP. 20/03/2023- This morning, I submitted a RFP response that included a quote of $350K per year for licenses and $200K for implementation. 25/03/2023- An appointment has been scheduled by the client, and invitations have been dispatched for a Q&A regarding our feedback - all principal stakeholders from the BA side are expected to attend. 27/03/2023- Our Q and A session was highly successful; we addressed all their concerns. Additionally, I suggested conducting a bespoke Post RFP workshop so we could walk them through a configured demo that encapsulates all their use cases. 28/03/2023-  The customer has requested that we conduct the workshop on 14th April. We are collaborating internally with the solution consulting group to ready the demo environment. 30/03/2023- In a conversation with Geoff Gables, the VP Sales and my primary contact, he mentioned that they are still securing their internal budget. They are going through several rounds of approval and the final one is slated for 21st April 2023. When asked about the budget they're trying to secure, Geoff didn't provide an exact figure but specified it would be enough to meet the solution's requirements. 14/04/2023- The demo session was a great success - with a duration of 4 hours, all stakeholders, including our Economic Buyer Jim Jackson, the Head of Operations, were present. We discussed all their major issues and answered queries related to service delivery and SOW. The next step is to finalize the SOW. I put forth the idea of a Value Engineering session to create a Proof of Value document, which they accepted. We've agreed to initiate the Value Engineering Session on April 21st. 21/04/2023- We successfully concluded the value engineering call and plan to provide them with the POV document by the conclusion of week. 27/04/2023 - Presented a point of view on value engineering. 28/04/2023- Initiated in-house work on the SOW, with a goal to complete the SOW and its final implementation program by May 5th, 2023. 05/05/2023- The SOW was delivered to the client with total services amounting to 195K. 07/05/2023- Call with the client to elaborate on the timeline and project plan in a SOW meeting. 10/05/2023- I spoke with my Champion, Geoff Gables, and inquired about the VOC announcement's intended date - he confirmed it should be by the end of next week. 17/05/2023- Having received the VOC award, we've now transitioned to engaging in discussions with Procurement. Our initial meeting with them is scheduled for the following week. 25/05/2023- In a conversation with the procurement department, they mentioned we have to decrease our pricing throughout all our products to progress. 26/05/2023- In consultation with internal management, it was agreed to provide a 5% additional discount if the deal is closed by the end of June. This comes after our RFP price was earlier marked down by 20% from the list price. 27/05/2023- In today's meeting with both the EC and the champion, we discussed creating a Mutual Activity Plan for closing all outstanding items. 27/05/2023- Today, send the Order form and the MSA to the client so their legal team can process the terms. 29/05/2023- The meet-up with the legal team and our own law professionals is set for 7/06/2023. 30/05/2023- During a conversation with the EB, he suggested including a termination for convenience clause. However, I expressed our inability to do so due to our revenue recognition requirements and instead, offered to include a termination for cause clause. 07/06/2023- The initial legal discussion concerning their contract points proceeded smoothly, though there are still some unresolved issues about Termination for convenience and Support terms. 09/06/2023- We dealt with the clients' redlines and gave back the contract. 10/06/2023- Today, I created the MAP and forwarded the template to the client for their perusal. 15/06/2023- Today, Legal confirmed their satisfaction with the MSA and will forward it for procurement to initiate the signing process. 20/06/2023- I found out today that the authorized signatory is away until the 4th of July. I reminded them that our price remains the same until the end of June, and we need to identify a substitute signatory. 26/06/2023- Ian Harper, the COO, has been identified as the back-up signatory and the contract is in for his signature. 30/06/2023- Today, the contract has been signed and expected to receive the order form by tomorrow, though it would be dated June 30th - last minute modifications on a few minor terms have been made by our Sales Ops. 01/07/2023- The deal is finalized - order form has been signed and purchase order obtained.``` identify the pain points faced by Account in its current workflows.

Our sales procedure is incredibly intricate and necessitates streamlining. The objective to boost the average deal magnitude.  Raise the rate of renewals by augmenting customer success. It's required to cut down the disproportion in their tech stack using one consolidated platform.
You are a sales assistant bot that helps sales agents in converting enterprise sales

Following is a set of dialogues that happened between a sales agent and a prospect from Account. ```08/12/2022- Commenced discussion with Ken Walnut about the potential of adding intelligence to our sales data. 16/12/2022- Ken, Geoff, and I had a discovery call to look into the VP Global Sales' pressing issues. They highlighted that the sales system is quite complex and needs simplification, and there is also a necessity to raise the average transaction size. They aspire to enhance the success rates of their customers to better serve their existing clients and uphold their renewal rates. They employ Salesforce and Gong.io, in addition to Outreach, for the initial stages of lead generation. Decided to pursue a demonstration of the proposed solution. The number of uncoordinated sales systems they have is overwhelming. We aim to provide a seamless, integrated platform experience that will let users handle most of their work in one application. 17/12/2022- The NDA has been sent for signature. 20/12/2022- I am still waiting for the NDA to be returned. I've also emailed Jim Jackson, who heads operations, introducing myself and Dealstream, with the intention of maybe bringing him into the scheduled demo session.  23/12/2022- Sent an email to stakeholders urging them to advocate for the NDA, as well as proposing convenient dates and times for the demonstration.  01/01/2023- he NDA was received back and it was mutually agreed upon that the best date for the demonstration would be 7th January 2023. Ken received an email to specify and give us information about those who will be attending the session. 07/01/2023- Everything went well in the demo session. While they appreciated the UI/UX, they declared that integration with their tech stack including Gong must be guaranteed. It's necessary to schedule a call with their team and our product management group to instill confidence that this integration project is feasible. In addition, there was some concern around data privacy which they need their Data Privacy team to look into.  I've urged them to transmit their DPA to us, potentially by the week's end. 14/01/2023- Key Takeaways: Undertook a thorough needs assessment involving Account. Identifying specific difficulties and obstacles they encounter. Talked about how the implementation of AI software solution could tackle these problems successfully. 21/01/2023- Had a conference where the key topic was data protection and security implications of our AI software solution. We also reviewed its compliance with the data protection needs of Account. 22/01/2023- Carried out a demonstration of a new AI software solution, highlighting its primary features and functions. Presented its potential integration into Account' current operations to improve processes. 30/01/2023- Addressed all inquiries and difficulties that cropped up after the product presentation. Cleared up technical details and integration prerequisites while specifying the probable ROI for Account. 07/02/2023- Submitted a personalized proposal detailing the AI software solution, its merits, and its congruity with Account' requirements. Engaged in a dialogue concerning price points and potential timeframes for deployment. 14/02/2023- The customer has indicated their intention to send out RFPs to roughly 5 possible solutions. Their plan is to have the RFP sent out within the next three weeks, no later than February 28th, 2023. I am liaising with our internal RFP team to prepare a proper template for the client. 21/02/2023- The client received our RFP template, but we discovered our competition includes Humantics AI and FairSale. The client hasn't confirmed they'll use our template, and is yet to provide the RFP document. 28/02/2023- Due to the internal priorities of the stakeholder team, the project has been delayed for a couple of weeks, and so has the RFP document. 07/03/2023- We have received the RFP document which seems to be based on the customer's personal template. Interestingly, it contains several points that coincide with our template. It makes me think that they have used parts of the data I shared with them. And just to update you, the deadline to respond to the RFP is the 21st March 2023, two weeks from today. 14/03/2023- The RFP documentation is still in the process of being completed while we await feedback from Product Marketing about what components can be included in the customer response. Additionally, we are waiting for the data privacy team to finalize the DPA section of the RFP. 20/03/2023- I finalized and submitted our RFP response today, proposing an annual rate of $350K for licenses and an implementation fee of $200K. 25/03/2023-  A meeting has been established, and the client sent out invites for a Q&A on our response - all essential BA side stakeholders must attend. 27/03/2023- The Q and A session unfolded favorably and we responded to every point they had. Furthermore, I recommended that we orchestrate a customized Post RFP workshop to show them a purpose-built demo, addressing all of their use scenarios. 28/03/2023- On 14th April, as per the customer's request, we are to run a workshop. Our solution consulting team is in the process of preparing the demo environment internally. 30/03/2023- The conversation I had with my key champion, Geoff Gables who is the VP Sales, revolved around their current internal budgeting process. It appears there are several approval stages with the final approval set for 21st April 2023. They couldn't provide an exact budget but stated it would suffice to cover the solution's requirements. 14/04/2023- Our 4-hour demo session was very productive with all stakeholders present, including Jim Jackson, the Economic Buyer and Head of Operations. We addressed all the key points they raised, along with some questions about service delivery and the Statement of Work (SOW). We agreed on my proposal to develop a value engineering session to formulate a Proof of Value document. The session is scheduled to begin on April 21st. 21/04/2023- The value engineering call has been completed and we must have the POV document with them by the termination of week. 27/04/2023 - Conveyed a perspective about value engineering. 28/04/2023- Commenced internal work on the SOW, targeting to finalize with the implementation program on 5th May 2023. 05/05/2023- The client received the SOW, the cost of all services amounted to 195K. 07/05/2023- SOW call scheduled with the customer to delve deeper into the specifics of the timeline and project plan.  10/05/2023- My Champion, Geoff Gables, was contacted by me, and he stated that the target date for the VOC announcement will be by the end of the coming week.  17/05/2023- We are pleased to announce that we've been awarded the VOC, and have subsequently begun consultations with Procurement. The inaugural contact with Procurement will take place in the coming week. 25/05/2023- We just had a discussion with procurement and they informed us that price reduction across all areas is necessary for any advancement. 26/05/2023- After conferring with our internal management, we've decided to grant an extra 5% discount on the already 20%-reduced RFP price, but on the condition that the deal closes by the end of June. 27/05/2023- Constructing a Mutual Activity Plan was the main topic discussed in the meeting with the EC and the champion today, that is intended to help us resolve all outstanding items. 27/05/2023- The MSA and Order form should be sent to the client today for their legal team's processing of the terms. 29/05/2023- Both our legal team and the additional Legal team are planned to meet on 7/06/2023. 30/05/2023- When the EB and I spoke, he insisted on a termination clause for convenience. Despite this proposal, I told him it was impossible due to our revenue recognition prerequisites, but agreed to a termination clause for cause. 07/06/2023- Our first official call to talk through their points on contract was successful. However, we still have some outstanding issues regarding Termination for convenience and Support terms. 09/06/2023- The clients' redlines were addressed by us, and we returned the contract. 10/06/2023- The MAP was put together by me today, then the template was submitted to the client for their check. 15/06/2023- Legal disclosed today that they are pleased with the MSA and will deliver it to procurement for streamlining the signature process. 20/06/2023- Today I learned that the signatory is on holiday until July 4th. I emphasized again that our quote remains stable until the end of June and we are in need of a contingency signatory. 26/06/2023- The back-up signatory, Ian Harper who is COO, has accepted and is expected to sign the contract. 30/06/2023- The contract was signed today and we anticipate the order form to arrive tomorrow, yet it would bear the date of June 30th - our Sales Operations team is adjusting some minor terms that emerged in the final moments. 01/07/2023- Purchase order received and order form inked, hence the deal is sealed.``` identify the pain points faced by Account in its current workflows.

They made clear their love for the UI/UX while also stressing that integrating with their full tech stack, especially Gong, is a prerequisite. A call has to be set between our product management squad and their team, so as to convince them about the possibility of the integration work. In addition, there was some concern around data privacy which they need their Data Privacy team to look into. Also emailed Jim Jackson, head of operations, to introduce myself and Dealstream with a view to perhaps including him on the planned demo session. 23/12/2022- Emailed stakeholders to push for the NDA and to suggest suitable dates/times for the demonstration. 01/01/2023- NDA returned and the 7th January 2023 agreed as the best date for the demonstration. Emailed Ken to identify and inform us of the attendees for the session. 07/01/2023- The demo session went well. They indicated that they loved the UI/UX; however, they would need to ensure that the integration with their whole tech stack, including Gong, would be something that we could do. Need to set up a call with their team and our product management team to give them confidence that this integration work can be delivered. Addressed how the solution complies with Account' data protection requirements. 22/01/2023- Held a product demo showcasing the key features and capabilities of the AI software solution. Demonstrated how it could be integrated into Account' existing systems to enhance their operations. 30/01/2023- Addressed questions and concerns that arose after the product demo. RFP response is due in 2 weeks from now, 21st March 2023. 14/03/2023- Completing RFP documentation - still awaiting feedback from Product Marketing on our roadmap and what can be released to the customer as part of the response. Working internally with the solution consulting team to prepare the demo environment. 30/03/2023- Spoken with my main champion there, Geoff Gables, VP Sales - he stated that they are currently in the process of securing budget internally - apparently, there are a few rounds of approval and the final approval meeting happens on the 21st April 2023. I proposed a Value Engineering session to build out a Proof of Value document - they accepted. Agreed to kick off the value engineering session on 21st April. 21/04/2023- Completed value engineering call, and we will have the POV document with them by the end of the week. 27/04/2023- Delivered Value Engineering POV. 27/04/2023 - Deliverd Value engineering POV. 28/04/2023- Started work on the SOW internally aiming to deliver the SOW with the final implementation program by 5th May 2023. 05/05/2023- Delivered SOW to the client - total services 195K. 07/05/2023- SOW call with the customer to discuss the timeline and project plan in more detail. 10/05/2023- Called my Champion, Geoff Gables, and asked him when the target date is for announcing VOC - he stated by the end of next week. 17/05/2023- We have been awarded VOC and have now moved into discussions with Procurement. The first call with Procurement is set for next week. 25/05/2023- Had a call with procurement who have stated that we need to look at reducing our price across the board in order for this to move forward. 26/05/2023- I discussed with internal management and we have agreed to offer a 5% discount given that our RFP price was already reduced by 20% from the list - this additional discount is tied to an end of June close date. 27/05/2023- I met with both the EC and the champion today to discuss building a Mutual Activity Plan for us all to work towards completing all outstanding items to close. 27/05/2023- Sent our MSA and Order form to the client today to process the terms through their legal team. 29/05/2023- Meeting with the Legal team and our legal team scheduled for 7/06/2023. 30/05/2023- Had a conversation with the EB, and he indicated that a clause for termination for convenience will be required - I mentioned that this is not possible due to our revenue recognition requirements and that termination for cause will be added. 07/06/2023- First legal call to discuss their points on the contract went well - we have some outstanding points around Termination for convenience and Support terms. 09/06/2023- We addressed the client's redlines and returned the contract. 10/06/2023- I built the MAP and sent the template to the client today for their review. 15/06/2023- Legal confirmed today that they are happy with the MSA and will submit it to procurement to push through the signature process. 20/06/2023- Discovered today that the signatory is on vacation until 4th July. I reiterated that our price holds until the end of June and we need to find a backup signatory. 26/06/2023- A backup signatory identified and contract in for signature with Ian Harper, COO. 30/06/2023- Contract signed today, and the Order form expected tomorrow, however, will be dated 30th June - some minor terms on the order form came up at the last minute; our Sales Ops are changing. 01/07/2023- Order form signed and PO received - Deal closed.``` Based on the information given in triple quotes, identify the problems that the sales agent encountered during the Account opportunity.

I reiterated that our price holds until the end of June and we need to find a backup signatory. 26/06/2023- A backup signatory identified and contract in for signature with Ian Harper, COO. 30/06/2023- Contract signed today, and the Order form expected tomorrow, however, will be dated 30th June - some minor terms on the order form came up at the last minute; our Sales Ops are changing. 01/07/2023- Order form signed and PO received - Deal closed.``` Based on the information given in triple quotes, What all are the specific actions that helped resolving customer pain points?
